title: Tori Spelling reveals the '90210' co-star she had a summer fling with
text:
Tori Spelling reveals the '90210' co-star she had a summer fling with In case you weren't aware, it's the 25th anniversary of Beverly Hills, 90210. Post to Facebook Tori Spelling reveals the '90210' co-star she had a summer fling with In case you weren't aware, it's the 25th anniversary of Beverly Hills, 90210. Check out this story on wtsp.com: http://on.wtsp.com/1LdmKoH Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Tori Spelling reveals the '90210' co-star she had a summer fling with USA Today, USAToday.com 6:05 a.m. EDT October 5, 2015 Actress Tori Spelling attends Eva Longoria and LG Electronics Host "Fam To Table" Series at The Washbow on Aug. 22, 2015 in Culver City, Calif. (Photo: Alberto E. Rodriguez, Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
In case you weren't aware, it's the 25th anniversary of Beverly Hills, 90210 . Yep, the soapy TV drama made its debut in 1990, introducing us to Brenda and Brandon Walsh, a set of teen twins recently transplanted from wholesome Minnesota to flashy Beverly Hills. 
To commemorate, Lifetime did what it does best (worst??) -- recently, at least -- and on Saturday aired an unauthorized TV movie about the show's behind-the-scenes drama. But what really has people talking is the one-hour sit- down with series star Tori Spelling that aired afterwards. 
In it, she dished on the real behind-the-scenes drama, and we learned: 
She had a summer fling with co-star Jason Priestley. 
"It was our version of, like, a summer romance, the 90210 version and that was it," she said. "You know, we stayed great friends for the rest of the run, and beyond that, but yeah, we had that one summer fling." 
But contrary to rumors, she never tried to sell Priestley's wedding invitation at a garage sale. "I would never do that," she said. "I think the world of his wife and him and I am terribly mortified and embarrassed if that ever happened, and if it did, it was literally as a joke. I wasn't trying to make money off his wedding invitation."
